item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, November 16, 2024 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Astronomers find 2 galaxies aligned where their gravity acts as a compound lens (86 points | 18 comments)
2. Logica – Declarative logic programming language for data (23 points | 5 comments)
3. James Webb Space Telescope finds evidence for alternate theory of gravity (26 points | 4 comments)
4. Military's UFO-hunting aerial surveillance system detailed in report (23 points | 1 comment)
5. SICP: The only computer science book worth reading twice? (2010) (53 points | 21 comments)
6. Statistical Rethinking (2024 Edition) (15 points | 2 comments)
7. Show HN: I built a(nother) house optimized for LAN parties (73 points | 18 comments)
8. Yggdrasil Network (177 points | 69 comments)
9. Treating bullying as everyone's problem reduces incidence in primary schools (39 points | 4 comments)
10. Optimizers: The Low-Key MVP (60 points | 3 comments)
11. Numpyro: Probabilistic programming with NumPy powered by Jax (48 points | 8 comments)
12. New haptic patch transmits complexity of touch to the skin (3 points | discuss)
13. Netflix buffering issues: Boxing fans complain about Jake Paul vs. Mike Tyson (294 points | 530 comments)
14. Ask HN: What open source projects need help? (110 points | 45 comments)
15. Is the UK's liver transplant matching algorithm biased against younger patients? (60 points | 25 comments)
16. The race to commercialise nuclear-powered batteries (20 points | 6 comments)
17. Don't Look Twice: Faster Video Transformers with Run-Length Tokenization (17 points | 3 comments)
18. Show HN: Android Dev Quest – A puzzle game solvable only using developer tools (49 points | 5 comments)
19. I tried every top email marketing tool (54 points | 45 comments)
20. PermitFlow (YC W22) is hiring senior/staff engineers in NYC ( | hide)
21. Four dead in fire as Tesla doors fail to open after crash (81 points | 59 comments)
22. Casio has released a ring in the form of its iconic watch (105 points | 50 comments)
23. C Compiler to SPIR-V (42 points | 1 comment)
24. Readme.so – Easy way to create a README (41 points | 19 comments)
25. Kyanos: eBPF-based network issue analysis tool (158 points | 12 comments)
26. Surveillance and the history of 19th-century wearable tech (42 points | 9 comments)
27. Pleasant Debugging with GDB and DDD (45 points | 1 comment)
28. YC is wrong about LLMs for chip design (155 points | 135 comments)
29. Dtype_dispatch: a macro that defines macros that define enums and match them (9 points | discuss)
30. Virtual Shoe Museum (3 points | 1 comment)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, November 16, 2024 at 8:15 PM UTC
